info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 2 at 6:42PM CDT until August 2 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Chambers County in Central Alabama.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valley, Lanett, Lafayette, La Fayette, Waverly, Lakeview, Five Points, Cusseta, Chambers County Lake, Buffalo, Denson, Sturkie, West Chambers, Oak Bowery, Penton, Fredonia, Huguley, Ridge Grove, Trammel Crossroads and Veasey Creek Park.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING
